#summary Describes features and functionality of the parser.
#labels Module-Blaise,Phase-Implementation

= Description =
The `blaiseparser` package provides basic parsing functionality. Some principles for the parser:
  * case-insensitive
  * permits pseudonyms for functions, e.g. "avg", and "average" work the same

= Features =

== Supported Operators ==

== Supported Constants ==

|| Name || Description || Remarks ||
|| `pi` || pi=3.141592653589793... || ok ||
|| `e` || e=2.718281828459045... || ok ||

== Supported Functions ==

=== Basic ===

|| Name || Description || Remarks ||
|| `sqrt` || square root of the argument || ok ||
|| `cbrt` || cube root of the argument || ok ||
|| `abs` || absolute value of the argument || ok ||
|| `floor` || first integer at or below the argument || ok ||
|| `ceil` || first integer at or above the argument || ok ||
|| `round` || closest integer to the argument || ok ||
|| `signum` or `sign` or `sgn` || the sign of the argument, as +1 or -1 || ok ||
|| `frac` || the "fractional" part of the argument (i.e. what follows the decimal) || ok ||

=== Trig Functions ===

|| Name || Description || Remarks ||
|| `sin` || sine || ok ||
|| `cos` || cosine || ok ||
|| `tan` || tangent || ok ||
|| `asin` or `arcsin` || inverse of the sine function || ok ||
|| `acos` or `arccos` || inverse of the cosine function || ok ||
|| `atan` or `arctan` || inverse of the tangent function || ok ||

=== Exponentials, Logs, and Hyperbolic ===

|| Name || Description || Remarks ||
|| `sinh` || hyperbolic sine || ok ||
|| `cosh` || hyperbolic cosine || ok ||
|| `tanh` || hyperbolic tangent || ok ||
|| `log` or `ln` || natural logarithm || ok ||
|| `log2` || base-2 logarithm || ok ||
|| `log10` || base-10 logarithm || ok ||
|| `exp` || exponential of the argument, ie. e^x || ok ||

=== Random Numbers ===

|| Name || Description || Remarks ||
|| `rand` or `random` (no argument) || generates a random number between 0 and 1 || not working ||
|| `rand` or `random` (2 arguments) || generates a random number between the two arguments || ok ||

=== Statistical Features ===

|| Name || Description || Remarks ||
|| `avg` or `average` || average of multiple comma-separated values || not working ||
|| `min` or `minimum` || minimum of multiple comma-separated values || ok ||
|| `max` or `maximum` || maximum of multiple comma-separated values || ok ||

== Supported Branching Statements ==

|| Name || Description || Remarks ||
|| `if` || conditional switch || not working ||
|| `sum` or `summation` || summation over indexed set || not working ||
|| `prod` or `product` || product over indexed set || not working ||
